name: additional_properties
description: A JSON string containing any payload properties not present in the schema

fields.name: android_sdk_version
fields.description: The optional Android specific SDK version of the software running on this hardware device.

fields.name: app_build
fields.description: The build identifier generated by the CI system (e.g. "1234/A"). For language bindings that provide automatic detection for this value, (e.g. Android/Kotlin), in the unlikely event that the build identifier can not be retrieved from the OS, it is set to "inaccessible". For other language bindings, if the value was not provided through configuration, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

fields.name: app_channel
fields.description: The channel the application is being distributed on.

fields.name: app_display_version
fields.description: The user visible version string (e.g. "1.0.3").  In the unlikely event that the display version can not be retrieved, it is set to "inaccessible".

fields.name: architecture
fields.description: The architecture of the device, (e.g. "arm", "x86").

fields.name: client_id
fields.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the client.

fields.name: device_manufacturer
fields.description: The manufacturer of the device the application is running on. Not set if the device manufacturer can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

fields.name: device_model
fields.description: The model of the device the application is running on. On Android, this is Build.MODEL, the user-visible marketing name, like "Pixel 2 XL". Not set if the device model can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

fields.name: first_run_date
fields.description: The date of the first run of the application.

fields.name: os
fields.description: The name of the operating system. Possible values: Android, iOS, Linux, Darwin, Windows, FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, unknown

fields.name: os_version
fields.description: The user-visible version of the operating system (e.g. "1.2.3"). If the version detection fails, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

fields.name: telemetry_sdk_build
fields.description: The version of the Glean SDK

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES"). If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is ["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers), to indicate "undetermined".

fields.name: build_date
fields.description: The date & time the application was built

fields.name: windows_build_number
fields.description: The optional Windows build number, reported by Windows (e.g. 22000) and not set for other platforms

fields.name: session_count
fields.description: An optional running counter of the number of sessions for a client.

fields.name: session_id
fields.description: An optional UUID uniquely identifying the client's current session.

fields.name: campaign
fields.description: The attribution campaign (e.g. 'mozilla-org').

fields.name: content
fields.description: The attribution content (e.g. 'firefoxview').

fields.name: medium
fields.description: The attribution medium (e.g. 'organic' for a search engine).

fields.name: source
fields.description: The attribution source (e.g. 'google-play').

fields.name: term
fields.description: The attribution term (e.g. 'browser with developer tools for android').

fields.name: name
fields.description: The distribution name (e.g. 'MozillaOnline').

name: document_id
description: The document ID specified in the URI when the client sent this message

fields.name: geo
country
fields.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

fields.name: db_version
fields.description: The specific geo database version used for this lookup

fields.name: subdivision1
fields.description: First major country subdivision, typically a state, province, or county

fields.name: subdivision2
fields.description: Second major country subdivision; not applicable for most countries
Results of a geographic lookup based on the client's IP address

fields.name: header
date
fields.description: Date HTTP header

fields.name: dnt
fields.description: DNT (Do Not Track) HTTP header

fields.name: x_debug_id
fields.description: X-Debug-Id HTTP header

fields.name: x_pingsender_version
fields.description: X-PingSender-Version HTTP header

fields.name: x_source_tags
fields.description: X-Source-Tags HTTP header

fields.name: x_telemetry_agent
fields.description: X-Telemetry-Agent HTTP header

fields.name: x_foxsec_ip_reputation
fields.description: X-Foxsec-IP-Reputation header

fields.name: x_lb_tags
fields.description: X-LB-Tags HTTP header
Headers included in the client's HTTP request

fields.name: user_agent
fields.description: Parsed components of the client's user agent string

fields.name: isp
db_version
fields.description: The specific geo ISP database version used for this lookup

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the ISP associated with the client's IP address

fields.name: organization
fields.description: The name of a specific business entity associated with the client's IP address when available; otherwise the ISP name
Results of ISP lookup based on the client's IP address

fields.name: glean_baseline_locale
fields.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

fields.name: search_default_engine_code
fields.description:
If the search engine is pre-loaded with Fenix this value
will be the search engine identifier. If it's a custom search engine
(defined: https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/1607) the
value will be "custom"

fields.name: search_default_engine_name
fields.description:
If the search engine is pre-loaded with Fenix this value
will be the search engine name. If it's a custom search engine
(defined: https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/1607) the
value will be "custom"

fields.name: metrics_distribution_id
fields.description:
A string containing the distribution identifier. This was used
to identify installs from Mozilla Online, but now also identifies
partnership deal distributions

fields.name: glean_client_annotation_experimentation_id
fields.description:
An experimentation identifier derived and provided by the application
for the purpose of experimentation enrollment.

fields.name: first_session_install_source
fields.description: Used to identify the source the app was installed from.

fields.name: glean_baseline_duration
fields.description: The duration of the last foreground session.

fields.name: events_total_uri_count
fields.description:
A counter of URIs visited by the user in the current session, including
page reloads. This does not include background page requests and URIs from
embedded pages or private browsing but may be incremented without user
interaction by website scripts that programmatically redirect to a new
location.

fields.name: glean_validation_metrics_ping_count
fields.description: The number of metrics pings sent during the lifetime of this baseline ping.

fields.name: events_normal_and_private_uri_count
fields.description:
A counter of URIs visited by the user in the current session, including
page reloads. This includes private browsing.  This does not include
background page requests and URIs from embedded pages but may be
incremented without user interaction by website scripts that
programmatically redirect to a new location.

fields.name: glean_error_invalid_label
fields.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set with an invalid label.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

fields.name: glean_error_invalid_value
fields.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set to an invalid value.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

fields.name: metrics_search_count
fields.description:
The labels for this counter are `<search-engine-name>.<source>`.

If the search engine is bundled with Fenix `search-engine-name` will be
the name of the search engine. If it's a custom search engine (defined:
https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/1607) the value will be
`custom`.

`source` will be: `action`, `suggestion`, `widget`, `shortcut`, `topsite`
(depending on the source from which the search started). Also added the
`other` option for the source but it should never enter on this case.

fields.name: glean_error_invalid_state
fields.description:
Counts the number of times a timing metric was used incorrectly.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

fields.name: glean_error_invalid_overflow
fields.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set a value that overflowed.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

fields.name: browser_search_ad_clicks
fields.description:
Records clicks of adverts on SERP pages.
The key format is
`<provider-name>.in-content.[sap|sap-follow-on|organic].[code|none](.[channel])?`,
where:

* `provider-name` is the name of the provider,
* `sap|sap-follow-on|organic` is the search access point,
* `code` is set when the url matches any of the provider's code prefixes,
* `channel` is set to the url "channel" query parameter.

fields.name: browser_search_in_content
fields.description: Records the type of interaction a user has on SERP pages.

fields.name: browser_search_with_ads
fields.description:
Records counts of SERP pages with adverts displayed.
The key format is
`<provider-name>.in-content.[sap|sap-follow-on|organic].[code|none](.[channel])?`,
where:

* `provider-name` is the name of the provider,
* `sap|sap-follow-on|organic` is the search access point,
* `code` is set when the url matches any of the provider's code prefixes,
* `channel` is set to the url "channel" query parameter.

fields.name: glean_validation_pings_submitted
fields.description:
A count of the built-in pings submitted, by ping type.

This metric appears in both the metrics and baseline pings.

- On the metrics ping, the counts include the number of pings sent since
  the last metrics ping (including the last metrics ping)
- On the baseline ping, the counts include the number of pings send since
  the last baseline ping (including the last baseline ping)

Note: Previously this also recorded the number of submitted custom pings.
Now it only records counts for the Glean built-in pings.

fields.name: glean_validation_first_run_hour
fields.description: The hour of the first run of the application.

fields.name: metrics_default_browser
fields.description: Is Fenix the default browser?

name: normalized_app_name
description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized app name

name: normalized_channel
description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized channel name

name: normalized_os
description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized OS name

name: sample_id
description: Hashed version of client_id (if present) useful for partitioning; ranges from 0 to 99

name: submission_timestamp
description: Time when the ingestion edge server accepted this message
